The inside of the restaurant looks really cute, especially the paintings on the wall. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great vegan/vegetarian place, and look forward to going back for lunch or dinner.

This is the only dedicated, 100% vegetarian restaurant in Madison, WI. 90% of the menu is vegan, but they offer real cheese.  Some of their menu items are really delicious, but other items fall short.   DEVIL WINGS -  So good! I always ask for extra buffalo sauce in lieu of ranch.   RAW TACO PLATE -  Delicious! Their walnut chorizo bursts with flavor and their creamy cilantro jalapeño dressing is the icing on the raw taco cake. I would definitely order this again.   VEGGIE LOAF DINNER - I've been looking for a great vegan meatloaf. Unfortunately, I wasn't a fan of their walnut loaf version.  SOUTHWEST FILET - Delicious! I omitted the pico de gallo and added some of their chipotle remoulade  ROASTED RED PEPPER CORNBREAD -  Good taste, but my piece was a little hard.  MACHO NACHOS -  I don't like cheese. Didn't like it before I was vegan and I don't like vegan versions. Usually, I can still get some awesome tasting nachos sans cheese. This was not the case at Green Owl Cafe. They were boring and lacked flavor. I wouldn't get them again.   SANTE FE SALAD -  I felt like I paid $11 for a head of iceberg lettuce with a few sprinkles of veggies. This salad was a joke and my wallet was the punchline.  It is over-priced and I would not order this again.   CHERRY CHEESECAKE -  Sweet and decent. Not the best vegan cheesecake, but it's ok.  Despite me not loving everything that I've had, I can't give them less than 4 stars. The good items are great and they get an extra star for being the one and only dedicated-vegery in this town. I'll be returning here on my next visit to MSN.
If your vegan, and you are in town, this is a must visit spot!  Awesome choices and desserts are tasty!! TLT With Avocado.  Was really really good!! I totally recommend!!

Good but not great vegetarian food. It seems to be more tailored to the vegetarian who is looking for a meat substitute than the one who is just looking for a hearty vegetable-centric meal. As more of the latter, it's never called to me very strongly. Be that as it may, I am always happy to go as the food is perfectly decent, the service is friendly, and the atmosphere is cute. Also, they have outdoor seating in the summer which is a plus.

I stopped at Green Owl Cafe for lunch and was not disappointed.  I had the TLT (Tempeh instead of bacon) with Avocado.  The sandwich was very tasty.  The portion was a bit small and left me wishing I had a little more food.  For my side, I got the quinoa.  The quinoa was cooked perfectly and seasoned to perfection.  I'm not even a huge quinoa fan and really enjoyed this side.  We also tried a side of their kale chips for an appetizer.  The chips provided that salty crunch you're looking for and are definitely worth a try.  Overall, this was a good lunch experience.

While in the land of Dairy, figured I'd struggle finding a compassionate place to eat.  A friend of a friend happens to be a vegan chef in Wisconsin and recommended this restaurant to me  Small, but packed full of personality.  The menu was loaded with options and variety.  I ordered the "crabby cakes" for appetizer and the Jackfruit quesadilla (vegan cheese and sour cream) for dinner  Smooth, creaming and satisfying flavor - best of all nothing was killed and my dinner guest (a meat eater) experienced satiety without a traditional "protein" from a "Being".   Service was top notch and when in Madison again, I'll return for sure

My husband and I went on a road trip to Madison this weekend. Honestly, to eat. Vegnews magazine featured Madison to be super vegan friendly, and it did NOT disappoint.  Green owl was lovely. I had the meatloaf dinner which had a lovely tomato reduction sauce, mashed tatoes and gravy, and roasted broccoli! Our app was the crabby cakes. Damn good. Vegan cheesecake for dessert? OK!   Vegan friendly cocktails? YES! I got the strawberry cheesecake martini made with coconut milk. DO NOT SKIP THIS DRINK! Yum!  The service was good, too! Our waitress was very patient. I was overwhelmed to have so many options, something we all know isn't a typical luxury at many restaurants.  Thank you green owl, I can't wait to drive back just to eat your treats!

Green Owl is out of this world. I could not believe how big their menu was and how delicious each item was!  Green Owl is located in a string of other bars/restaurants in the heart of the Atwood neighborhood. It is a full vegan or vegetarian restaurant, but non-veg friends that have joined me have been very pleased as well.  On our most recent visit, we ordered the raw taco plate as an appetizer. It was good, but not very filling. I was intrigued and also very much enjoyed the "chorizo" filling in the lettuce cups.   For dinner, my friend and I both split the jackfruit quesadilla and the TLT (tempeh lettuce tomato). A highlight for the TLT was the Madison Sourdough bread. The jackfruit quesadilla was also quite tasty; I'd recommend that as the best item I've had from there.   Pro tip: they make a homemade jalapeno hot sauce that isn't too spicy. Make sure to ask for it!  We didn't get a chance to try their desserts, but based on the other reviews, I really want to go back and try them!

Really liked the food here.  Even though the portions are not huge, i thought it was worth the price.  I especially liked thr main courses I tried: the schnitzel and the 'pork' cutlet with spaetzel.  Both are rare on vegan menus, and both delicious.  The crabby patties were excellent as well.  Service was ok for me, but a large group there seemed to have some difficulty.

Road trip weight gain is real, and my efforts to curtail the circumference of my belly during my travels led me to the vegan Green Owl Cafe, where I sought a reprieve from my usual diet of animal products. The Cajun-seasoned tofu and roasted potatoes were delicious, and for a brief moment I felt free from my dogged hunger to feast upon that which was once living. The awkward one-sided date spiraling into the ground next to me couldn't even disturb the peaceful vibe of the cafe. It was a bright summer day, and the server was gracious enough to turn down the sun for those of us seated outside, something I haven't seen accomplished in many, many years. I'll definitely return!

This place has amazing food for most vegetarians.  I just ate here and had the "BBQ Pork" sandwich.  It was a little too sweet because it had too much coleslaw on it, but once I took it off the sandwich, the two separated were delicious!  We tried the curry and bean (or lentil, can't remember) soup that was their soup of the day, and it was extremely addicting, and so was their vegan ranch dressing I had on my side salad.  I honestly can't wait to go back and try other sandwiches there.  The only 2 reasons I only gave this place 3 stars, though, are:  1. Price - $9 got me the sandwich and a side salad, no drink.  When the sandwich came out, I was pretty disappointed in the size of it.  Sure enough, even with the side salad and half of the soup I split with my husband, I wasn't full after my whole meal.  They need to make these portions bigger, give you more sides, or drop their prices.  2. Service - the place was only half full, and there were 3 waitresses.  Ours was nice, nothing overly friendly or rude about her, just nice.  No one seated us right away, nor was there a sign saying if we should seat ourselves or wait to be seated, so my party of 4 just stood around trying to figure out what to do for about 3 minutes before someone even noticed we were there.  Once we were seated, we had enough time to look at the menu, and our waitress took our order.  The food didn't take too long to come out, but once we did have our food, I asked for more water and my husband asked for some hot sauce.  She only came back with the water after taking another table's order, cleaning the men's bathroom and cleaning 2 tables, by which time I was almost done with my extremely dry meal.  She then came over like she knew all along with the water, didn't apologize for the wait, and filled our glasses and dropped off the bottle of hot sauce (also after my husband was nearly done with his meal).  Lastly, it took her 20 minutes (I'm not kidding) from the time we finished her meal for her to clear our plates and get our checks to us, and that doesn't include running the cards and bringing back our receipts.    Basically, this is a delicious place for extremely good vegetarian and vegan food, and I'm ecstatic that Madison has this cafe here, but in the future I think I'll just order things to go instead of suffer through 2 hours of my life trying to just eat a quick meal (with nothing to drink).

Loved this place! Were visiting from the Twin Cities and stopped here fora quick dinner and cocktail before a concert. Service was quick and courteous and the food was excellent! Flavorful and fresh. Lots of diverse choices. Our favorite dish was the devil wings, as being a vegetarian doesn't allow us to get anything like that at a restaurant, typically, and they were SO GOOD. Cocktails were wonderful as well.
This place is great, had a veggie loaf dinner and it's bomb. Also had a blueberry lemon poppy seed cheesecake. Highly recommended

There are many places to eat like this one in Los Angeles...eco-chic decor, funky service staff, eclectic diners...but thus far, this is the ONLY place in town that I have found a place where I can eat ANYTHING on the menu!!  Being in America's Dairyland, I suppose I cannot complain at the scarcity of vegan fare, but finding a place that was created specifically to fill that untapped niche is absolutely fantastic.  I have tried numerous things on their menu, with my favorites either being the BBQ Jackfruit sandwich or the Crab Cake Po'Boy sandwich.  I'm also a fan of their empanadas and gyro specials...and let's not forget dessert!  I don't even care if I'm completely stuffed...I always have to try a new dessert when I come here.  Vegan marshmallow creme?!  Vegan grasshopper cheesecake?!  Yes, please!

My wife saw a news piece on this restaurant, so we thought we'd give it a try.  I have never eaten in a vegan restaurant before.  I tried the Meatball Sandwich, which had no meat.  My wife had the TLT with Avocado sandwich using gluten free bread.  My sandwich was excellent.  My wife enjoyed her meal as well.  The bread on her sandwich was baked in house, not frozen.  She was amazed at how much it tasted like regular bread.  For dessert, we had Coconut Cream Pie that was Vegan & gluten free and was wonderful.  They really seem to take pride in what they serve and the waitress was very knowledgeable and answered all questions regarding the menu.  We are adding The Green Owl to our list of eateries.

It's always a great find when you encounter a restaurant that looks for inventive ways to serve delicious, healthy food - and The Green Owl Cafe does just that.  My husband loves the BBQ jackfruit sandwich (which on a blind taste test, can be mistaken for pulled pork) and I enjoyed the stuffed red pepper.  Simple in design and flavor, I am also a huge fan of the kale crisps appetizer and have incorporated it into my repertoire of good eats.
Awesome! Great veg/vegan food! And great waitstaff.

Not a vegetarian.  However, decided to try this place.  Had the vegetarian chili and it was mediocre at best.  Tastes like it was made several days in advance.  Salad was good.  The meatball sub was o.k. too.  However, I didn't see much inventiveness.  It was all imitation meals made with fake meat products.  Why no eggplant parmesan sandwich?

This was my first experience with vegan food. It was EPIC! I had the BBQ Jackfruit sandwich with kale chips. The kale was made perfectly and not burned (according to my companion this is difficult)   We finished with the chocolate lava cake & coconut cream pie. Both were AMAZING! As a non-vegan I was impressed at how much it really tasted like chocolate. I would say these desserts tasted better than any desserts I have ever had!

I had asked to see 3 items from the dessert menu and they said refused to bring them for me to see. It was a little annoying bc the place was empty but I went ahead and ordered a pistachio cheesecake that was not bad or fantastic. I unfortunately left feeling a little grossed out because when I grabbed two spoons from the utensils section, they were very visibly dirty. I told the waiter at the bar and he noticed that all of the spoons there were dirty and offered to grab me one from the back but I wanted to leave quickly. I am not sure if I will be back, at least not soon.

Awesome! As a vegetarian it's really nice to know you can eat anything and everything off this menu. The buffalo wings are perfection. The meatless loaf and mashed potatoes are great. The brunch sandwich is delicious. Even my meat eater uncle loved the crabby cake poboy he got. Desserts are fantastic. And the drink menu sounds great but I haven't had the chance to try them yet.

I love this restaurant. I've had dinner here more than a few times and it's such a pleasure to be able to close your eyes, point to the menu and know that whatever you hit upon is going to be not only a vegetarian dish, but tasty and delightful. Stocking local ingredients (and liquor) is a huge plus. Every time I've eaten their food I come away feeling like I've done something good for myself.

This restaurant is one of the best kept secrets in Madison. If you have any food allergies or food preferences... this is the place for you. The waitress can help you make food choices. I am amazed at the delicious food and so many choices! The pastry chef makes gluten and wheat free desserts that are unbelievably delicious. Please try this restaurant, you will not be disappointed.

Green Owl doesn't advertise as a caterer but I wanted a vegetarian wedding and was struggling to find caterers that offered vegetarian cuisine besides pasta and various meals with portabella mushrooms substituting for the meat dish. I asked them on a whim and they agreed. They were very casual and we usually had to remind them about deadlines and things but they got everything done we needed in the end and were very pleasant to work with. Unlike many catering companies, they were extremely accommodating with menu requests through the wedding planning process. They worked with us on the many ideas we had for the menu and also provided great suggestions. For instance, my (now) husband loves beets and wanted to add them into one of the dishes but we weren't sure it would go well. A few days later I got an e-mail from Jenny with an appetizer suggestion -- crostinis with goat cheese and heart-shaped roasted beets (get it? heart-beet! I uploaded a picture because they were so darn cute). They were a total hit at the wedding and super delicious. In fact, we got rave reviews on all the food from our guests. Prices were similar to other caterers but we think we got more bang for our buck than if we'd gone elsewhere (ex. way more variety on appetizers). If your wedding is 100 people or fewer, Green Owl can also provide dishware and glassware which was much more convenient than having to rent those from another company. Overall, we really enjoyed Green Owl and would definitely recommend them for your vegetarian/vegan catering needs!

Finally got a chance to check this place out and I must say, I am impressed!   The restaurant was super cute. It seemed to be well laid out, I liked the bright and fun colors of the walls, and it was super clean which is always a good sign. It was pretty warm inside - they had the front door open (it was a beautiful day) but the fresh air didn't quite it make all the way in to the place. I would have preferred it to be a bit cooler inside but that wasn't a big deal.   The food was great! We started with the devil wings. SO GOOD! I would absolutely order these again.   I went with the jackfruit quesadilla and my mom went with the pesto alfredo.   The quesadilla was really yummy. It was a little dry - I would order it again, but I would get a sauce to dip on the side for sure. It was really filling. The rice that came on the side was really nice as well - it was a light and fresh flavor. Paired well!   My mom said her pasta was also super yummy. It looked really good, and I think I might try that next. It came with garlic bread as well. The bread was tasty!   Overall, I like this place. I will be back, for sure!
Was good...TLT with avocado delish.. Reasonably priced.. I just went there again and had the jackfruit BBQ which was good along with the kale chips as a side that was surpassingly good.
Nice cozy atmosphere. Indoor and outdoor seating. Specializing in vegan and vegetarian cuisine. Plenty of variety. Delicious!

Great food and great atmosphere.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Best vegan options that I've found in Madison.  I will travel for good vegan food, and this is worth it.  I wish there were more places like this in the Madison area.
Best Sandwiches- actually, in general best vegan dinner spot in town. I never have to worry if there's meat or dairy in my food :) and raw food nights are amazing!
